title: Python - The Language For Mobile Development
summary: Python is an open-source programming language developed in the late 1980s by Guido van Rossum at the National Research Institute for Mathematics and Computer Science in the Netherlands. Itâ€™s simple and easy to learn, yet capable of handling large and complex projects. Python is one of the most widely used programming languages, with thousands of organizations using it for various applications. Python code is easy to read and understand, which makes it a good choice for newcomers and experienced developers alike. It can also be used for web apps, data science and IoT projects.

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...a}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...a,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Why Python?"),mdx("p",null,`Python is a mature, versatile programming language that has been adopted by thousands of businesses and organizations worldwide for a variety of applications.
It\u2019s simple and easy to learn, yet capable of handling large and complex projects. And because it can be applied to various industries and disciplines, it\u2019s a language that can easily transition as your career progresses.
By learning just one programming language, you\u2019ll be able to work in a variety of industries. You\u2019ll also be better positioned to find employment during economic downturns, when companies are forced to reduce their hiring.
This is because there are often fewer job candidates who can speak all the necessary languages.
When you have only one language under your belt, you\u2019ll be able to get a foot in the door at companies where other candidates are rejected because they don\u2019t have the necessary skill sets.`),mdx("h2",null,"What is Python?"),mdx("p",null,"Python is an open-source, general-purpose programming language developed in the late 1980s by Guido van Rossum at the National Research Institute for Mathematics and Computer Science in the Netherlands. It\u2019s often described as \u201Cexecutable pseudocode,\u201D which means that the code resembles a sort of hybrid between natural language and a more formal programming language. The code can be read and understood like normal sentences, but also follows the syntax and structure of programming languages like C."),mdx("p",null,"Before we go any further, let\u2019s clarify the meaning of open-source. Open-source software is software whose source code is available for anyone to see and modify. The vast majority of modern software is open-source, including languages such as C, C++ and Java. There are also many popular applications that are open-source, such as WordPress, VLC and Firefox."),mdx("h2",null,"why not just use Swift or Java?"),mdx("p",null,"There are lots of programming languages that can be used to create mobile apps. But we often hear developers asking \u201CWhy use Python for mobile app development?\u201D There are a few programming languages used for app development, but the two most popular choices are Swift and Java. Both of these languages have been around for many years and are used by many developers. So, why not just use one of these languages?"),mdx("p",null,"Let\u2019s take a closer look at each language and how it stacks up against Python:"),mdx("p",null,"Swift - This Apple-owned programming language was originally created for iOS app development. Swift is a compiled language and uses a runtime system."),mdx("p",null,"Java - This language was created for use in web apps but can also be used for mobile app development. It\u2019s an example of a compiled language and uses a runtime system."),mdx("h2",null,"Key reasons to use Python for mobile development:"),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Open source. This is a big one. Many businesses use open source software, and Python happens to be one of the most common languages used in this field.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Versatile. This language can be used for various disciplines and industries. Companies in different fields can employ Python to create solutions for their business challenges.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Broad adoption. Python is one of the most widely used programming languages, with thousands of organizations using it for various applications.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Huge community. Python has a strong and active community that supports and promotes the language.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Easy to learn. Newcomers to programming often find Python to be an easy language to learn.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Easy to read. Python code is easy to read and understand, which makes it a good choice for newcomers and experienced developers alike."))),mdx("h2",null,"Whats the downside of using Python?"),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"It\u2019s not always the best choice. In most cases, Python is a solid choice for developers. But there may be situations where it\u2019s not the best option. If you\u2019re creating an app that needs to run at extremely high speeds, C++ might be a better choice.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"The community is growing. Python\u2019s popularity has increased in recent years. This means that more developers are using this language, which may create some challenges for you if you encounter other Python developers on your team.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Like any language, Python does have its limitations. It\u2019s not the best choice for real-time systems, for example."))),mdx("h2",null,"Summing up"),mdx("p",null,"With all these benefits and advantages, it\u2019s easy to see why Python is such a popular language for mobile app development. If you\u2019re creating an app that will primarily target iPhones or Android phones and tablets, this is a good choice."),mdx("p",null,"It\u2019s also useful to know that Python is not just for mobile apps. It can also be used for web development, data science and IoT projects. This makes it a useful skill to have in your tool belt, no matter what type of work you do."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...a}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...a,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`A programming language is only as good as the people who use it. It\u2019s not enough for a programming language to be perfect, complete and universal; if no one uses it, it\u2019s useless. That\u2019s why the design of any new programming language involves a lot of user research. The creators of Python \u2014 an open-source general-purpose programming language first released in 1991 \u2014 recognized from the start that if they were going to succeed, they needed to create a language that was accessible and appealing to a wide audience. And so, despite its many advanced features, Python remains transparent and straightforward, with syntax that directly addresses the needs and abilities of most programmers.
Read on to learn more about this brilliant programming syntax and why you should take some time to get acquainted with Python today!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...a}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...a,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Today, with the prevalence of mobile devices and IoT, users expect applications to respond quickly and provide an engaging experience. Concurrently, businesses demand cost-effective solutions to meet these demands. This creates a need for high-performance, cross-platform apps that can be easily deployed on various devices. JavaFX can be your best bet for developing such apps.
With JavaFX, you can build rich client applications that are high performing, responsive, and have a natural user interface (NUI). In this post, we will explain what JavaFX is and what it brings to the table. We will also see some examples of where this technology is being used. If you\u2019re interested in learning more about its benefits and implementation details, keep reading!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Coding Tricks for Beginners
Python - The Language for Web Scraping

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Web scraping is the practice of extracting data from websites. In this blog, we\u2019ll discuss why you should learn Python for web scraping, as well as provide examples, resources and suggestions for getting started. The world wide web has made it easier than ever to share information with one another. However, that same ease of access has also made it harder than ever to separate useful information from noise. Because of this, many developers have turned to web scraping in order to extract the information they need from websites without having to manually search or filter through everything individually. Luckily for you, Python is a perfect language for getting started with web scraping! This blog will cover why you should learn Python for web scraping and offer useful resources to get started learning it."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Python - The Language for System Automation

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Automating tasks is a way of making your life easier. Imagine this, you need to run a report every day and it takes 5 minutes each time. You could either set an alarm and rush back to the desk in 5 minutes or create a script to automate this process. The latter leaves more time for you to focus on more important things. What if you could automate even the simplest tasks? Wouldn\u2019t it free up your time for better things? That\u2019s where Python comes into play. As an automation scripting language, it can help you automate even the simplest of tasks and free up more time for work that matters. Automation helps businesses in many ways. It saves time, increases efficiency and decreases costs by eliminating manual processes. In this blog, we will explore why Python is such a popular programming language for system automation and how it can be used to automate simple repetitive tasks in your organization. Let\u2019s get started"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Python - The Language of the Web

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`With the rapid growth of the internet and mobile app market, it\u2019s no wonder that developers are in such high demand. As a result, more people than ever before are learning how to code as a secondary career option or as a means to break into the tech industry.
Unfortunately, there are so many coding languages out there that it can be difficult to know where to start. Luckily, we\u2019re here to help!
Python is one of the most popular programming languages in existence today with an abundance of demand for qualified programmers. And as one of the most commonly used programming languages for statistical analysis and data science, Python is also extremely useful for web developers looking to branch out from other coding languages like JavaScript or Java.
Keep reading to discover everything you need to know about Python and why you should learn it!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: TypeScript Tutorial: A Beginner's Guide to TypeScript

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019ve been following the world of programming for the past couple of years, you have probably heard about TypeScript by now. This is because it\u2019s one of the most interesting and accessible ways to get started with modern programming languages. Since its release in 2014, TypeScript has become extremely popular among developers from all over the world, including those who usually avoid any new software or tools that are still in beta testing phase.
This article will cover everything you need to know about TypeScript and why exactly this language has caught the attention of so many programmers. It also includes a list of tutorials on how to get started with TypeScript as fast as possible so that you can use it effectively in your future projects as well.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
